overview_of_class: In the third quarter of Elementary Persian, students will become acquainted with a variety of more complex language structures, including the subjunctive and conditional moods. By the end of the quarter, they will be able to express their own wishes and fears and correctly produce conditional sentences in the context of daily living. They will be able to read and write simple texts related to daily life and on topics with which they are familiar, and will develop skills for reading and extracting the main point from more complicated materials.
name: Persian I

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: PERS 111-2 or permission of the instructor.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Class time is devoted to language production in small groups; grammar is taught inductively

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Weekly quizzes combined with five project-based assessments.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Shahsavari and Atwood, Persian of Iran Today, Vol. 2

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Suggested)
descriptions.value: Saeed Yousef and Hayedeh Torabi, Basic Persian
